title: Lecture: Rubens, Rembrandt, and Drawing in the Dutch Golden Age
title_display: Lecture: Rubens, Rembrandt, and Drawing in the Dutch Golden Age
hero_caption: Rembrandt van Rijn. Kostverloren Castle in Decay, about 1652. Clarence Buckingham Collection.
short_description: Exhibition curator Victoria Sancho Lobis traces the innovative developments of Dutch and Flemish drawing in the Golden Age. If this program reaches capacity, a stand-by line will form outside the venue 30 minutes before the event for seats that become available.
description:
Exhibition curator Victoria Sancho Lobis traces the innovative developments of Dutch and Flemish drawing in the Golden Age. Explore work by artists such as Peter Paul Rubens and Rembrandt van Rijn, and understand the various roles that drawings played for artists, collectors, scholars, and art lovers in the 17th century.

Persons with disabilities who would like to request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program are encouraged to send an email to access@artic.edu two weeks in advance of the program.
